intro: Ceropegia maculata, commonly known as the spotted chainplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically greenish-white with a distinctive hooded structure. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia maculata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral features.
